Ini, Lembaga dan Kepala Daerah Terbaik Dalam Pelayanan Publik
06 Nov 2019, 05:05 by Agus Wijananto


Ini, Lembaga dan Kepala Daerah Terbaik Dalam Pelayanan Publik

KBRN, Jakarta : Kementerian Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara dan Reformasi Birokrasi (PANRB) menyerahkan hasil evaluasi pelayanan publik di wilayah III, yang meliputi Sulawesi Tengah, Sulawesi Utara, Gorontalo, Sulawesi Tenggara, Sulawesi Selatan, Sulawesi Barat, Maluku, Maluku Utara, Papua, Papua Barat, Jawa Tengah, dan D.I Yogyakarta.Untuk Provinsi Sulawesi Tengah, tidak dilakukan evaluasi dulu, sebab daerah itu masih dalam tahap pembangunan pasca bencana alam. Namun terdapat satu pemda yang dilakukan evaluasi di provinsi tersebut, yakni Kabupaten Banggai. Lokus evaluasi pada wilayah III ini adalah 11 provinsi dan 67 kabupaten/kota.Deputi bidang Pelayanan Publik Kementerian PANRB, Diah Natalisa mengatakan, Indeks pelayanan publik di wilayah ini mendapatkan predikat B atau “Baik” yakni sebesar 3,51. Diah mengingatkan perolehan predikat tersebut, unit pelayanan publik tidak boleh berpuas diri. "Artinya, masih perlu kerja keras dan komitmen masing-masing pemda di wilayah III untuk menuju pelayanan publik yang prima," ujar Diah dalam acara Penyampaian Hasil Evaluasi Pelayanan Publik Wilayah III, di Jakarta, Selasa (05/11/2019).Pada acara ini, Menteri PANRB Tjahjo Kumolo memberikan penghargaan kepada 11 unit pelayanan publik yang mendapat hasil evaluasi dengan predikat A (pelayanan prima). Selain itu, penghargaan diberikan kepada 13 kepala daerah sebagai pembina pelayanan publik terbaik. Piagam juga diberikan pada kepala daerah dari Papua yang mendapatkan penghargaan sebagai wujud hasil dari program percepatan pembangunan Papua.Dari hasil evaluasi tersebut, Diah memberikan beberapa hal yang perlu dicatat. Diantaranya adalah pelibatan masyarakat dalam perumusan kebijakan khususnya penyusunan standar pelayanan. Kemudian, unit pelayanan juga harus mengelola pengaduan untuk perbaikan kualitas pelayanan publik dan pendokumentasian kegiatan yang dilakukan. "Unit juga harus melaksanaan survei kepuasan masyarakat dan menindaklanjuti survei," pungkasnya. Unit Penyelenggara Pelayanan Publik Kategori Pelayanan Prima:1. RSUD Tugurejo2. RSUD Cilacap3. These are the Best Institutions and Regional Heads of Public Services
Nov 6, 2019, 05:05 by Agus Wijananto


These are the Best Institutions and Regional Heads of Public Services

KBRN, Jakarta: The Ministry of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform (PANRB) submits the results of evaluation of public services in region III, which includes Central Sulawesi, North Sulawesi, Gorontalo, Southeast Sulawesi, South Sulawesi, West Sulawesi, Maluku, North Maluku, Papua, Papua West, Central Java, and DI Yogyakarta. For Central Sulawesi Province, no evaluation was made first, because the area was still in the post-natural development stage. However, there is one regional government that has been evaluated in the province, namely Banggai Regency. The locus of evaluation in region III was 11 provinces and 67 regencies / cities. Deputy for Public Services at the PANRB Ministry, Diah Natalisa said, the index of public services in this region received the predicate B or "Good" which amounted to 3.51. Diah reminded the acquisition of the title, public service units should not be complacent. "It means, it still needs hard work and commitment from each regional government in region III to reach excellent public services," Diah said in the Submission of Regional Service Evaluation Results in Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). At this time, the Minister of PANRB Tjahjo Kumolo gave awards to 11 public service units that received evaluation results with the title A (excellent service). In addition, the award was given to 13 regional heads as the best public service supervisor. The charter was also given to the regional head of Papua who received an award as a result of the acceleration of the Papua development program. From the results of the evaluation, Diah gave several things to note. Among them is the involvement of the community in the formulation of policies, especially the preparation of service standards. Then, the service unit must also manage complaints to improve the quality of public services and document the activities carried out. "The unit must also carry out community satisfaction surveys and follow up on surveys," he concluded. Public Service Provider Unit Prime Service Category: 1. Tugurejo Regional Hospital2.
